inn1.comm: back of a length outswinger, too wide of off stump to make Fletcher play so early in the match
a bit fuller, still too wide to induce a stroke from Fletcher
back of a length on off stump, good bounce and shape away. Fletcher goes back and across to defend
length ball outside off, Fletcher shuffles across, gets behind it, and blocks it back to the bowler
full now, outside off stump, jabbed away into the cover point region. Looked like a slower ball, and Fletcher had to wait a bit before poking it away
yorker, just outside off, blocked back towards the bowler
back of a length outside off, curls away from the batsman, who opens his bat face to steer it to the right of third man
back of a length, angling into off stump. Fletcher shuffles across and works it through square leg

stuck on the crease, and Lakmal makes him pay. Went a bit wider of the crease, and bowled it straight and quite full. No footwork as he tries to defend from the crease, and the ball strikes his back pad right in front of middle stump. Given out straight away, and the batsman trots off. Thought of reviewing, decided against it.
bouncer first up, but he gets his line wrong. Way down the leg side, and it swerved further down, giving Kusal no chance of stopping it from running away to the boundary
length ball, straightens towards middle stump. Bravo lets it come on and tucks it away towards deep backward square leg
back of a length outside off, a bit of away swing. Left alone
fullish outside off, left alone again
full, angling in a long way, ends up sliding down the leg side

angled in again, and Bravo is struck on the front pad coming forward to defend. Loud shout from Malinga, he seems sure it's out, and he's even got Mathews to agree to a review, but it looked to me like Bravo had got his pad outside the line of off stump. Let's see. Is there an inside edge too? Two noises. Not sure if it's bat on ball or bat slamming into pad. I don't think there's an edge, but he's moved his front pad a long way outside off stump. Not out. Wasted review for Sri Lanka.
in the blockhole close to off stump, poked out towards mid-off, and it went slowly to the fielder, allowing the batsmen to sneak a single

length ball outside off, steered to the left of backward point, but Dilshan ensured there would be no single. Moved extremely quickly and dived to cut the ball off, and bounced up quickly to throw at the stumps as well.

clever, clever slower ball. Dipped on a middle-stump line, right up in the blockhole, and almost sneaked under the bat for a sure-fire lbw, but the batsman just about managed to jam his bat down and pick up a couple towards fine leg
another dipping slower ball, very full on off stump, defended back to the bowler
again, the slower ball right up to the batsman. Defended into the point region this time.
back of a length on leg stump, nudged away towards long leg
beauty. Moves away off the seam, in the corridor, from just back of a length. Fletcher is squared up and his outside edge is beaten

oh my. It's shortish, with plenty of width, and Fletcher simply pokes it to backward point. Didn't seem to go into that shot with full conviction, just pushed at it rather than give it the full-blooded slap, and ended up spooning a fairly straightforward catch to the fielder
back of a length outside off, left alone
lots of away movement, but starts wide enough for Samuels to leave easily alone
fuller now, and Samuels leaves again. Lakmal smiles, because Samuels simply didn't move his feet while leaving this. That sort of footwork to a straighter delivery could have him in a lot of trouble.
full, slanting away from Bravo and just threatening to swing back in. Bravo goes for the drive away from his body, and inside-edges into his back pad.

good bouncer, attacking Bravo's right shoulder. Bounced quickly, and Bravo was caught hopping there, taking his eye off the ball. Hands go up in a flail, and the ball hits him on his front arm and drops down into the leg side
short again, but not dug in with as much body behind it. Gets up to just over waist height, outside off, and Bravo pokes it away towards point

two short balls, and now the yorker. Brilliant stuff from Malinga, and Bravo's feet were pinned in place as he hurriedly tried to work it into the leg side, but the ball was just a bit off target, swinging down the leg side when it hit his pad
full outside off, and Bravo's front foot moves nicely into position to play a flowing drive to the right of mid-off. Lovely shot
full-toss outside off, and the outward angle causes Bravo to edge it as he leans forward to play a checked drive. The nick rolls away wide of slip

bouncer first up, and Samuels gets into a terrible position while ducking, crouching only at the waist and presenting the back of his head towards the bowler. Luckily for him, the ball bounces well above it
back of a length on off stump, defended to backward point with an open face
full outside off, and Samuels gets off the mark with a checked drive to the left of extra cover
length ball, a bit of swing into Bravo to cramp him for room. Defended watchfully to midwicket
full, angling into off stump. Bravo gets a good stride out to defend into the on side
back of a length, angling into middle stump, tucks it into the leg side, and Samuels wants one, but the ball is too close to midwicket and Bravo sends him back

lovely delivery, lots of shape away from a good length outside off. Well played by Samuels, you'd have to say. No footwork back or forward, but he shuffles across to get close to the ball, and keeps bat close to body and lets the ball swing past without chasing it with his hands.
no swing this time. Comes in with the angle from just back of a length, and Samuels tucks it away through square leg
another good bouncer, another display of poor ducking technique. This time it's Bravo who takes his eyes off the ball, but it's angling away and bouncing too high to hit him

digs it in again, not as short as the previous ball, and the pitch is slow enough for Bravo to negotiate it safely, getting back and across and defending towards point. Played that with good, soft hands
again it's short, and this time it's a touch wider outside off. Looks to poke it away, and it's in the air for a while, but it bounces well short of the point fielder
right up in the blockhole this time, on off stump, and Bravo plays it well, defending it with the angle towards cover
and Lakmal beats Samuels with an away-curler pitched just back of a length. In the corridor, and Samuels is opened up, but once again he keeps his bat close to his body and doesn't jab at the ball
back of a length on off stump, defended into the off side off the back foot
good length, poor line, sliding down the leg side
beauty. Full outside off with some late outswing, and Samuels throws his hands at a drive away from his body, he's lucky there's no edge
back of a length, good bounce and carry through to the keeper after Samuels shapes to poke and then decides to leave

is that out? Given! Umpire thought about it for a while, but it looked out. Samuels shuffled across and this one came in with the angle instead of curling away as it has been doing all through the over. Hits him above the knee roll, so height might be an issue. Samuels has reviewed...  He's on his toes, looking to work it across the line. They're checking for the inside edge. I don't think there's one. Height has to be the main issue, but it only has to clip, because the on-field umpire gave this out. Umpire's call it is, and Samuels has to go. Ball-tracking suggests it would have shaved the leg bail.
length ball, swinging down leg. Looks to work it into the leg side and it swings past his inside edge to hit his front pad. Impact well outside leg stump
short ball rising over off stump, played down towards point with an angled bat
back of a length outside off, steered to backward point.
dipping yorker on middle stump, and Bravo has to be extremely vigilant to stab it out into the cover region

lovely delivery. Length ball pitching on middle and off, threatening to curl into the left-hander before leaving him slightly off the pitch. Kept his head over the ball and defended it well, into the cover region
and again the slower dipping yorker. Jams his bat down and squeezes it towards square leg
length ball on middle and off, good positive stride out to defend to extra cover
length ball straightening a touch towards middle stump. Played out watchfully towards midwicket
fullish, fourth-stump line, defended to mid-off
a touch too straight, swings onto the pads and Bravo gets a lovely delicate touch on it to glance it to the fine leg boundary
bangs it in short, and Bravo hops in the air to keep it down, rolling his wrists over to play it into the leg side, off his ribcage
short again, tucked off the hips towards backward square leg
back of a length on off stump, played towards midwicket with the angle, with a roll of the wrists on top of the bounce
tossed up, fourth-stump line. Carter leaves it alone, and then has his heart in his mouth as it doesn't turn. Doesn't miss off stump by much
slower, straighter, dips a touch and carries on towards middle and off. Defensive jab squeezes through bat and pad and rolls close to the stumps
back of a length now, defended into the off side
fuller again, driven down the ground to long-off
length ball on middle and off, defended into the off side
a bit slower on off stump, loopier, Bravo gets forward to block
tossed up from around the wicket, defended into the off side
a bit quicker, still quite full, defended off the front foot
fired in flatter towards off and middle, and Carter uses the pace to lap-sweep to the left of short fine leg
a bit of air and width and Carter skips down the track to flat-bat firmly to the left of sweeper cover
flat, round-arm, angled into middle stump, clipped away through square leg
tossed up on off stump, driven through Dilshan, who fumbles after a bit of bad bounce at short extra cover
lbw appeal as this hurries in with the angle. Bravo, coming forward to defend, managed to get a bit of inside edge into his pad
shorter now, and he goes back quickly to punch to sweeper cover
down the track, driven down to long-off. A bit more air on this ball
not short enough to cut, keeps a bit low too, and he flat-bats it back to the bowler
slower now, and he gets forward to push into the covers
a bit of flight, but it lands shortish, and he goes back to punch. Can't beat short cover, though
quickish outside off, goes back to cut, can't get it past the diving man at backward point
tossed up slower now, and he comes forward to poke it to point
goes wide of the crease and bowls it full and flat on off stump. Driven down the ground towards long-off
slowish length ball outside off, a bit of turn, and he pokes it away to backward point
a touch short and he rocks back to slap it to sweeper cover
nice change of pace and angle. Goes wide of the crease again, gets it to straighten away just a touch outside off, and Carter keeps his eye on it all the way as he shoulders arms
loopy delivery close to off stump, blocked into the covers
length ball on middle stump, goes on the back foot to tuck it to midwicket
shortish, some width, chopped away to sweeper cover
appeal for lbw as Carter looks to lap-sweep. No turn from around the wicket, and he was a long way down. Struck somewhere in front of middle stump. May have missed leg.
looks to work the ball into the leg side but it's quicker, and it pops off the leading edge into the point region
tossed up slow and wide, and Bravo slashes and misses

bowled him, and that's Jayasuriya's first ODI wicket. Fired in quick from wide of the crease, around the wicket, and it goes on with the arm. Carter, trying to make room for the late cut, is cramped and bowled
back of a length, middle-and-leg line, tucked away quietly through square leg
flat, angling into off stump, Bravo plays a whip-pull down to wide long-on
full and flat on off stump, blocked to mid-off
once again it's full and flat, but this time Russell was expecting it. Clears his front leg and smacks it hard down the ground, between the umpire and mid-off
flat on leg stump, worked away through square leg
short and wide, and Russell goes on the back foot to thump it towards the cover boundary, where the heavy outfield slows the ball down
tossed up wide of off stump and Russell uses the room to free his arms, sink to one knee, and slog-sweep over the midwicket boundary
waist-high full-toss on leg stump, clubbed away without really timing it, towards short fine leg
length ball outside off, keeps a bit low as Bravo goes on the back foot to cut. Jams it down into the pitch instead
down the track and Senanayake pulls his length back. Looks to work it across the line and the ball hits him on the pad
shortish outside off, opens up and pulls to the right of the man at deep midwicket
offbreak, back of a length outside off, no power on it as Russell slaps to cover point
again it's shortish outside off, and he pulls powerfully but straight to long-on
full outside off stump and Bravo gets under it to slice over cover. Slows down near the boundary again
on the pads and Bravo can't bring his bat around quickly enough to flick it. Rolls off the pad towards short fine leg
tossed up wide of off stump, and that's not the best area to bowl at when Russell is on strike. Uses the swinging room to launch it straight back over the bowler's head and over the rope
once again tossed up and wide, and Russell reaches out to slice it away to the backward point boundary
shortish outside off, pulled down to long-on
length ball wide of off stump, and Sri Lanka continue to feed Russell's favourite hitting zone. Just swings freely and launches it over wide long-on
length ball outside off, dabbed away towards short third man
full on middle stump, and Bravo comes forward, gets his front leg out of the way, and pokes it gently into the cover region to bring Russell back on strike
shortish wide of off stump, chopped away into the covers, doesn't really get hold of it
shortish outside off, slapped to extra cover
short and wide to start and Russell cracks him away to the point boundary, a full-blooded square cut with his bat finishing over his head
short and wide again, and this time Dilshan dives to his right from a deepish backward point to stop what would have definitely been four otherwise

wide outside off again, but this one was banged in with extra venom, and it bounced way over Russell's flashing blade. Replay suggests it should have been called wide. Went beyond the tramline for sure
slower length ball on off stump, and that's intelligently done by Russell. Lets it come on and opens his bat face to find the gap between short third man and backward point
good bouncer, over off stump this time, and Russell can only duck under it
as expected, the short ball. Bounces high outside off stump, and Russell doesn't make an attempt to play
length ball on off stump, makes a bit of room and flat-bats to long-off
length ball outside off, goes deep in his crease and pulls to deep midwicket
length ball on off stump and Bravo clears his front leg to launch it high and just clear the long-on boundary
shortish outside off, whip-pulled to deep midwicket with a lot of bottom hand
lbw appeal as Russell misses a slog-sweep, but there seemed to be an inside edge onto back thigh, and the ball then rolled into the point area
length ball on off stump, makes room to give it a big slap but can't beat the extra cover fielder
slower bouncer outside off, and Russell can't connect with his slash
full on off stump, and it's too full for Russell to get the elevation he needs. Tries to get under the ball to launch it over long-off, and ends up scooping a simple catch to the fielder instead
back of a length, ends up getting his line wrong, well down the leg side
back of a length on leg stump, tucked away towards square leg
length ball angling into middle stump, and Brathwaite has no room to do anything but poke the ball into the covers
length ball on middle stump, Bravo uses the angle and pushes it into the off side for a single
wow. Length ball on off stump, and that was a stunningly clean hit. Cleared his front leg and just powered that over long-on
shortish offbreak on middle and off, Bravo drags a pull towards deep midwicket
loopy and full angling down leg, and Brathwaite, looking to swipe across the line, can't make contact, is hit on the front pad
full on middle and off, swiped down to long-on
oh my. Was looking to angle it away from Bravo, and ended up overdoing it. Keeper had to take it behind the return crease
gone. Slower offbreak on middle and leg, and Bravo swings across the line and misses. Bravo miss, Mendis hit.
length ball on middle and off, and Holder hits a six first ball. Just swings through the line and clears the long-on boundary easily
back of a length, quicker, on middle and off. Tucked away quietly through the wide mid-on region
slower ball outside off, swings through the line and the ball dribbles down to long-on, over the slow outfield. Gives them enough time to run two
length ball wide of off stump, flat-batted to long-off, to his left. They try to take on his arm and run two, and he goes to the keeper's end. Holder makes his ground safely
full and wide, and a bit of outswing to beat Holder, who has a big swing and a miss

shortish outside off, effort ball, and it hit high on the bat as Holder looked to pull. Looped up towards long-on, who had to come in a long way. Senanayake dived forward to catch it, couldn't quite hold on to the low chance
short again, angling into the body this time, pulled away to deep midwicket
length ball, a bit of width, and Holder makes more room by clearing his front leg. Flat-bats cleanly and finds the gap to the left of long-off
length ball on middle and off, and once again Mendis profits from bowling stump-to-stump. Brathwaite swings across the line, and misses as the ball skids through off the pitch
length ball on off stump, poked away into the covers
down the track and Mendis bowls one wide of off stump. Out comes a beautiful, classical-looking drive, and it screams away to the extra cover boundary.
shortish, a bit of swinging room outside off, and Holder flat-bats it over the long-off boundary. Just sat up, and Holder timed it beautifully
length ball on middle stump, and Holder clips it down the ground to long-on
tossed up slow and wide of off stump, and Ramdin swipes it away to deep midwicket

short ball angling into off stump, and Holder gets into a superb position, gets his front leg out of the way, and keeps a stable base and swivels through the hips to launch that over the midwicket boundary
full on leg stump, and that's a well-timed clip from Holder, a pick-up shot that bounces just short of the rope and slows up enough for the deep midwicket fielder to chase it down to his right
yorker wide of off stump, dragged down the ground to long-on
short and wide and Ramdin makes a bit more room and slaps it over backward point
low full-toss on middle stump, and he clears his front leg and swings it away through square leg

good ball to end. An effort ball dug in short outside off. Goes over Ramdin's bat as he attempts to carve it through the off side, and Kusal underarms direct at his end to run out Holder as they try to sneak a bye

inn2.comm: back of a length, angling in, defended into the covers
full on middle and leg, and Perera gets his feet out of the way and punches down the ground with a straight bat, boom. In the gap between non-striker and mid-on
length ball wide of off stump, and Perera goes hard at it, his slap just eludes the fingertips of the leaping Johnson Charles at cover point
short, angling into the body, and Perera jumps in the air, leans his upper body out of the way, and stabs the ball down to third man
short, a long way down the leg side, and Dilshan can't connect with his pull
length ball on the pads, tucked away to midwicket

short again from around the wicket, and Perera looks to ramp it. It's in the air for a long time, and Fletcher, at third man, will wonder why he didn't come off the rope quicker. Went to him on the bounce in the end, but it could easily have been a catch had he come in quicker
full outside off and that is a smooth drive from Perera, just leans into it and gets it into the gap between cover point and extra cover
length ball on the pads, tucked away to square leg
full offbreak on leg stump, defended with the turn into the off side
fullish and wide of off stump, slanting away. Looks to slap it away, can't beat extra cover
slower now, on leg stump. Defended back to the bowler
flighted offbreak on leg and middle, defended with the turn into the covers
starts with a full ball on the pads, and Dilshan clips it away fine, finds the gap to the right of short fine leg
short ball, angling into the body, and Dilshan swivels violently to pull it up and over the long leg boundary
length ball angling into off stump, poked back to the bowler
full on off stump, driven to mid-off
good ball, gets some extra bounce as he angles this back-of-a-length ball across Kusal. Goes past the edge of his angled bat
back of a length on off stump. Looks to lean back and late-cut it, but can't beat the man at short third man
full-toss wide of off stump, driven straight to extra cover
slower ball outside off. Looks to lean across and play the scoop over fine leg, but can't get bat to it. Hits his front pad well outside off stump
in the blockhole outside off, jabbed away to mid-off
in the blockhole again, on middle and leg, and Perera digs it back to the bowler
slower ball on the pads, and Perera swipes across the line towards deep backward square leg, where it slows down near the boundary
length ball just outside leg stump, and Perera can't put bat to ball as he looks to muscle it into the leg side. Rolls off his pad to short fine leg
back of a length on off stump, slugged away over midwicket. No real timing on this
bouncer, top-edged hook, flies over the keeper and it runs away for four. Fine leg was inside the circle, so a bad ball to start with
back of a length now, angling in, and Dilshan plays the shot named after him, Dilscoops it over the short fine leg fielder and it carries all the way over the rope
short ball, and that is a sensational hook. Swivels on his back heel and absolutely smashes it over deep backward square leg

back of a length ball on off stump, and I think that's a run-out. Poked it to backward point and they took off for the single. Went straight to the fielder, Carter, and the direct hit finds Perera well short. Superb throw with only one stump to aim at.
length ball outside off, eased away into the gap at point
full on off stump, driven firmly to mid-off
slower ball on off stump, clipped to straight midwicket
short ball angling into the body, pulled away to long leg

length ball pings Thirimanne on the pad as he looks to work it across. Semi-confident appeal. Pitched outside leg stump from that over-the-wicket angle, I would think. Rolled away into the point region
slower ball, back of a length, angling into the body, whipped away to deep backward square leg
short ball, wide outside off, and Dilshan has dragged his pull wide of mid-on, almost a tennis shot, that, smacked sweetly into the gap
fullish on leg stump from over the wicket. Stays back and tucks it to midwicket
a bit more air now and he comes forward to defend. Inside-edges into his pad
full on leg stump, driven down to long-on
length ball outside off. Dilshan comes forward, waits on it, and dabs to backward point.
full on off stump, whipped down the ground to long-on
full on leg stump, comes forward, gets his foot inside the line, and drives with the turn to long-off

length ball on off stump, angling across, and it runs away off the outside edge through the vacant slip region. Thirimanne gets into an unsound open position while looking to drive to mid-on, with his bat coming down at an angle
back of a length outside off, dabbed to backward point with an open face
shortish outside off, and he gets on his toes to punch, can't beat the man at backward point
full on off stump, driven into the covers where Samuels slows the ball down with a dive to his right from short extra cover
short, angling into the body, pulled away to long leg
full-toss on leg stump, clipped away towards deep square leg
full outside off from around the wicket, driven square, sliced straight to backward point
banged in short, angling in, and Thirimanne watches it nicely and ramps it calmly over slip. One bounce and over the rope
fullish on middle stump, clipped away into the midwicket region
short ball, rises only hip high, and Dilshan punishes it, pulls it witheringly to the backward square leg boundary
back of a length, angling too far down leg, and Dilshan glances neatly off his hips to the fine leg boundary
in the blockhole on off stump and he clips it to mid-on and takes off immediately. Puts the fielder under pressure, produces the fumble, and picks up an easy single
and there's the fifty. Another short ball, another punishing hook to the backward square leg boundary
in the blockhole on middle stump, pushed down the ground to long-on
back of a length outside off, slapped hard into the ground and backward point leaps to field it
bouncer angled across Thirimanne, bounces too high for Thirimanne to play the ramp
short again, rising towards the ribcage, and he keeps it down nicely, rolls his wrists over to drop it into the leg side

an off-side run! Good ball, straightens after Holder hits the pitch hard, and he produces the leading edge as he looks to work it across the line. Pops into the point region. Good ball, but a no-ball too. He's overstepped here.
full-toss from around the wicket, cramping him by bowling close to his body, and he swipes it without timing it particularly well, down to deep midwicket
back of a length outside off, cut hard into the ground and backward point fields it over his head

wide of the crease, fuller, angling away, and Thirimanne drives away from his body and nicks to the keeper, who takes a good catch tumbling to his left. Lovely length from Brathwaite. An old-fashioned good ball. Why haven't West Indies tried to do this more often?
angling down leg, can't connect with the flick. Rolls off the pads towards fine leg
length ball outside off, steered away to third man
good ball, back of a length, straightens in the corridor, beats Mathews' outside edge. Umesh Yadav bowled a few of these to Mathews during the Tests against India recently
short, angling into the body. Not the most convincing short-arm jab. Sort of flapped at it, but the ball lands safely short of the long leg fielder, and well to his left
length ball, turns in towards off stump, cramps Mathews a touch but he manages to push it down the ground to long-on
short and wide, slapped away to deep point
length ball outside off, poked to short cover
length ball outside off, no turn this time as he looks to whip it across. Ends up playing it back to the bowler
length ball wide of off stump, pushed quietly to deep point
lovely delivery. Carrom ball. Comes forward to push the length ball into the covers and it cuts away and beats his outside edge
back of a length on off stump, goes on the back foot and defends with the angle to midwicket
down the track, and that wasn't the best looking drive down the ground. More of a heave, and he squeezed it into the gap to the left of mid-on
low full-toss on the pads, clipped away towards deep midwicket. Slows down near the boundary but they have enough time to complete three by the time deep square leg runs around
too full, on leg stump, and he clips it away towards deep square leg
gone. Back of a length, angling in to cramp him for room, and he nicks it to the keeper as he tries to carve it through point
back of a length, angling away from the left-hander. Good ball, and it beats the outside edge as he looks to defend from the crease
length ball on the pads, whipped away to long leg
length ball outside off, left alone
short outside off, forced stylishly off the back foot but straight to cover point
bouncer, and Gunathilaka ducks under it
length ball on middle and off, defended back to the bowler
short ball, looks to pull from over his back shoulder, and he doesn't get hold of it. The ball pops up wide of the man at slip
length ball on off stump and he uses the angle to steer the ball down to third man
back of a length, angling too far down the leg side
back of a length outside off, steered to third man with an open face
short ball, pulled away to deep square leg
length ball on off stump, clipped away to deep square leg
once again, he slips it down the leg side, a long way down the leg side, and fine leg has to mop up after Ramdin fails to grab it with a diving effort
back of a length, angling into off stump, worked away to deep square leg
fuller now, on off stump, and that's whipped away nicely, in the air but he picked his spot well, finds the vacant boundary in front of deep square leg
shortish outside off. Mathews shuffles across and tucks it into the midwicket region
again he shuffles across to a short ball outside off, gets his hands high to defend down into the pitch, back towards the bowler
length ball, comes in off the pitch, and Mathews inside-edges into his pad while looking to work it into the leg side from outside off

down the track, and he goes hard at the shortish ball outside off, ends up slicing it to third man, who takes a good catch falling forward. Don't know why he went for that shot with the required rate as manageable as it is
back of a length on leg stump, tucked away quietly to long leg
full outside off, steered with an open face to deep point
offbreak, turns a long way, but starts way outside leg stump
offbreak turning from leg to middle-and-off, defended carefully back to the bowler
length ball on the pads, tucked away through square leg
tossed up full outside off, driven quietly to sweeper cover
length ball, starts down the leg side, clipped away towards long leg
shortish outside off, turns away to give him more width, and he goes deep in his crease and plays a lovely controlled cut to the left of backward point
tossed up on off stump, driven down to long-off
length ball angling in from around the wicket, and Siriwardana plays a nice checked drive to sweeper cover
fuller now, angling in, defended to short cover
length ball wide of off stump. Goes at it with an angled bat and edges it. Rolls to the man at slip
short ball, pulled stylishly to deep backward square leg
short outside off, chopped to backward point
back of a length on off stump, makes a bit of room and steers it towards deep point
down the track, and that's Narine's first wicket. Got too close to the pitch of the ball, maybe, and got no elevation, hit it straight to Carlos Brathwaite at mid-on
shortish ball, no room to cut, and he jams it into the pitch off the inside edge
and again. Looks to open his bat face and steer a straight ball into the off side, and the ball straightens and bowls him off the inside edge. A forgettable debut innings for Shehan Jayasuriya

big offbreak, turns in and hits the front pad as Senanayake plonks forward to defend. Big appeal, not given. Are they reviewing it? Nope. I think it's missing leg stump, and maybe bouncing over too. Ball tracking says hitting leg stump, but impact is on the edge of off stump - umpire's call.
back of a length outside off, steered backward of point with an open face
bowled him! Three wickets in one over, and Narine is turning this around. Another big offbreak, pitches leg, hits off. Tentative footwork from Gunathilaka, and he's pushed down the wrong line
shortish outside off from Holder, and Senanayake is beaten, looking to run it down to third man with half a bat
short outside off, taps it on the top of the bounce to play it down to third man
full outside off, gets forward and steers it to third man with an open face
good bouncer, rises over the right shoulder and Senanayake can't connect with the pull
in the blockhole on off stump, jabs at it and can't beat the man at short midwicket
slower bouncer, Senanayake ducks under it

tossed up on off stump. Sweeps, can't get it past short midwicket, and he takes off for a needless single. Turns back, dives to regain his crease, and is his bat in by the time Ramdin takes the bails off? His bat seems to have bounced as he hit the ground, and it looks like it's in the air when the bails start to come off. Are they completely off, though, before he grounds it? Looks incredibly close. Not out is the third umpire's decision.
length ball tossed up outside off. No turn, and he plays inside the line, happy to get beaten
short now, and that's very well played by Mendis. Rocked back in a flash, made a bit of room, and cut it away to the point boundary

down the track now, saw mid-off inside the circle and looked to go over him. Narine saw him coming, bowled it full at his feet to cramp him, and he went through with his shot and just managed to clear the fielder. Took off for a second, and Senanayake wisely sent him back
once again a length ball outside off that doesn't turn too much, and the batsman plays inside the line and gets beaten
too wide from Narine, and this time Senanayake makes no effort to play the ball
down the track, and that's nicely played by Mendis. Stays inside the line of the length ball and scoops it over mid-off. Doesn't quite time it, but picked a vacant area
full outside off, and that's a nice shot, steps across, gets down low, and steers it with an open face towards deep backward point
yorker on middle stump, dug out safely into the off side
full and wide, and a lovely flowing drive to sweeper cover. Mendis is looking in beautiful touch with the bat
full on off stump, driven calmly down to long-off
low full-toss on the pads, whipped away to deep midwicket
low full-toss outside off, defended safely towards cover point
low full-toss on off stump, clipped to mid-on
good bouncer, angles into the batsman and cutting off any room. Defends that very well, does Mendis, keeps it down into the leg side
another good short ball, dug in and angling into the body. Defended safely into the off side
full on middle stump, clipped to midwicket
back of a length, angling into off and middle. Makes room to play that with a straight bat into the off side, ends up playing down the wrong line, inside the line
bouncer, and that's marginally down the leg side as Senanayake ducks to avoid it. Wide signalled. Maybe for height. Certainly for height.
shot! That's full, up there in Senanayake's slot without being full enough to deny him hitting room. Hits through the line with a straight bat, and hits it back over the bowler's head

length ball outside off, a bit of extra bounce. Mid-off went back and third man came into the circle before this ball, and he looked to dab it down to third man with an open face. Ball missed his edge. A bit of away movement too
bowled him! Length ball, nipped back from outside off, and it went through the gate and crashed into middle stump. Was looking to play through mid-off, maybe, but played too far in front of his body

another excellent full ball, and again there's no footwork. Nips back, hits the pad, and the umpire immediately upholds the lbw appeal. Malinga reviews. Is there an inside-edge on this? Nope. Straight onto back pad, and I think that's crashing into the stumps. Let's check with ball tracking anyway... I think that'll hit some part of leg stump. Yup. A big part of leg stump. Sri Lanka are nine down.
length ball wide of off stump, left gratefully alone
length ball close to off stump, gets forward to block it safely back towards the bowler
starts his over with a huge wide down the leg side. Mendis had walked across his stumps premeditatedly, looking for the scoop over fine leg
length ball on the pads, tucked away to short fine leg. They take the single
full on off stump, jabbed back to the bowler
on the pads, flicked into the square leg region
back of a length, not short enough, and no swinging room as he goes on the back foot to pull. Can only drag it feebly to midwicket

no-ball, full on middle stump. Swings it away, in the air. Deep midwicket dives forward, drops it. Wasn't a catch anyway. They run two. Extra ball. Three runs shaved off the target. It's all happening. Huge no-ball, that. And now a free-hit too
bang, and Sri Lanka win it. It's full, it's in the slot on middle stump. Mendis clears his front leg and absolutely smashes that, launches it way over wide long-on
